title: How to Make Apple Bread

steps.headline: Take the butter out of the refrigerator.
steps.description: Let the butter come to room temperature to soften it.

steps.headline: Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in the baking pan.
Mix 1/2 cup of sugar and 1 tablespoon of cinnamon in a small mixing bowl.
Sprinkle the sugar mixture in a 9" by 9" by 2" deep baking pan.
Cut one apple of any variety into thin slices.
steps.description: Arrange the apple slices in rows on the sugar/butter mixture.

steps.headline: Sprinkle a few raisins over the apples for extra taste.
Stir one package of active dry yeast and 3/4 cup water together in a large bowl.
Add 1/4 cup of sugar, 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 cup of flour.
Beat for two minutes or until the batter drops from the spoon in sheets.
steps.description: Then add 1 egg, 1/4 cup of shortening and 1-1/4 cups of flour. Beat until smooth.

steps.headline: Drop the batter by small spoonfuls over the apples and raisins in the pan.
steps.description: Cover the pan and let it rise in a warm place until double its size (about 50 to 60 minutes).

steps.headline: Heat the oven to 375 °F (191 °C).
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until brown.
Remove the cake from the pan immediately.
steps.description: Turn it upside down onto a serving plate.

steps.headline: Serve it to your friends or family and enjoy!
Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.
steps.description: Prepare the loaf pan by either greasing it and sprinkling with flour or lining with parchment paper. If lining with paper, cut the paper carefully to fit neatly in the corners, to avoid creasing the bread during baking.

steps.headline: Peel the apples.
steps.description: Chop into fine pieces. Divide into two halves for ease of use shortly.

steps.headline: Put the brown sugar and cinnamon into a small bowl.
steps.description: Mix together to combine. Put to one side.

steps.headline: Place the white sugar and butter into another larger mixing bowl.
steps.description: Mix by hand or stand mixer until a smooth mixture forms. If using an electric mixer, use medium speed.

steps.headline: Add the eggs one by one.
steps.description: Then add the vanilla and continue beating until combined well.

steps.headline: Add the flour and baking powder.
steps.description: Stir in. Then add the milk, stirring in. The batter is now formed.

steps.headline: Pour one half of the batter into the baking pan.
steps.description: Spread one half of the cut apples across the surface of the batter. Gently push down using the back of a large spoon.

steps.headline: Pour the second half of the batter over the top of the apples and first batter layer.
steps.description: Spread across to cover the apples completely. Sprinkle with some of the apple and cinnamon mixture made earlier, using about one quarter of the mix.

steps.headline: Spread the second half of the cut apples across the top of the cake batter.
Finish with the rest of the brown sugar and cinnamon mixture, sprinkling it evenly across the top of the cake mix.
steps.description: Gently pat down with the bag of the large spoon.

steps.headline: Place into the oven to bake.
steps.description: Bake for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven using oven mitts.
steps.description: Allow to stand in the pan for 10 minutes. Transfer to a wire cooling rack to cool until firm.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: The apple bread can be eaten still warm or when it is cold. Cut into slices and serve with tea or coffee. It goes well with butter or jam, if wished.

steps.headline: Finished.

text: Apple Bread with Yeast Take the butter out of the refrigerator. Let the butter come to room temperature to soften it. Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in the baking pan.  Mix 1/2 cup of sugar and 1 tablespoon of cinnamon in a small mixing bowl.  Sprinkle the sugar mixture in a 9" by 9" by 2" deep baking pan.  Cut one apple of any variety into thin slices. Arrange the apple slices in rows on the sugar/butter mixture. Sprinkle a few raisins over the apples for extra taste.  Stir one package of active dry yeast and 3/4 cup water together in a large bowl.  Add 1/4 cup of sugar, 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 cup of flour.  Beat for two minutes or until the batter drops from the spoon in sheets. Then add 1 egg, 1/4 cup of shortening and 1-1/4 cups of flour. Beat until smooth. Drop the batter by small spoonfuls over the apples and raisins in the pan. Cover the pan and let it rise in a warm place until double its size (about 50 to 60 minutes). Heat the oven to 375 °F (191 °C).  Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until brown.  Remove the cake from the pan immediately. Turn it upside down onto a serving plate. Serve it to your friends or family and enjoy!  Brown Sugar Apple Bread Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC. Prepare the loaf pan by either greasing it and sprinkling with flour or lining with parchment paper. If lining with paper, cut the paper carefully to fit neatly in the corners, to avoid creasing the bread during baking. Peel the apples. Chop into fine pieces. Divide into two halves for ease of use shortly. Put the brown sugar and cinnamon into a small bowl. Mix together to combine. Put to one side. Place the white sugar and butter into another larger mixing bowl. Mix by hand or stand mixer until a smooth mixture forms. If using an electric mixer, use medium speed. Add the eggs one by one. Then add the vanilla and continue beating until combined well. Add the flour and baking powder. Stir in. Then add the milk, stirring in. The batter is now formed. Pour one half of the batter into the baking pan. Spread one half of the cut apples across the surface of the batter. Gently push down using the back of a large spoon. Pour the second half of the batter over the top of the apples and first batter layer. Spread across to cover the apples completely. Sprinkle with some of the apple and cinnamon mixture made earlier, using about one quarter of the mix. Spread the second half of the cut apples across the top of the cake batter. Ensure an even coverage. Finish with the rest of the brown sugar and cinnamon mixture, sprinkling it evenly across the top of the cake mix. Gently pat down with the bag of the large spoon. Place into the oven to bake. Bake for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Remove from the oven using oven mitts. Allow to stand in the pan for 10 minutes. Transfer to a wire cooling rack to cool until firm. Serve. The apple bread can be eaten still warm or when it is cold. Cut into slices and serve with tea or coffee. It goes well with butter or jam, if wished. Finished.
